intro: Ligusticum alsaticum, commonly known as Siberian cowparsley, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with finely divided, fern-like leaves and small white to yellowish flowers. Its roots are sometimes used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats.
